summary: The Captive Primate Safety Act of 2025 amends the Lacey Act to prohibit certain activities involving prohibited primate species. It defines "prohibited primate species" broadly to include various primate species and hybrids. The bill generally prohibits importing, exporting, transporting, selling, receiving, acquiring, purchasing, breeding, or possessing these primates. Exceptions are made for entities transporting primates, those possessing primates born before the Act's enactment if registered and meeting other conditions, and research facilities. The Secretary of the Interior is tasked with creating related regulations. The bill also includes technical amendments to the Lacey Act.
